Reviews.Title: “SCAM!”
Reviews.Author: bobcore
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel, and have stayed here before. My last stay they charged me $250 for smoking...I DON'T SMOKE! They won't help me, and I'm currently in the process of disputing with my credit card company.

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: photopek
Reviews.Content: Great location,free shutle bus to the airport,free wi-fi,free breakfast,extremely friendly stuff,nice rooms.I will stay again

Reviews.Title: “Needs upgrade.”
Reviews.Author: rmejia
Reviews.Content: Pros: Location, free parking Cons: Rooms / AC / Bathrooms need to be upgraded

Reviews.Title: “2* Masquerading as a 3*”
Reviews.Author: mooth
Reviews.Content: Only here for one night but I was not impressed. No one was at the front desk for a good five minutes or more after I walked in. Was offered a few freebies from the "Snack Shop" as a Priority Club member, but there was almost nothing to choose from. The room was ok, but spare, with no microwave or extras. Bed and linens were ordinary. Found several hairs in the bathroom, on the shower wall and in the sink. In-room coffee was terrible. The fitness room was pathetic; not one single cardio machine worked. Pool was unheated and it was January, so too cold to try. Miami is expensive so it could have been worse, but it could have been a lot better, too. Not especially close to the airport and not recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Curtious yet unhelpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Brain5678
Reviews.Content: Shuttles only run every hour on the hour no exceptions. Hotel is bare. Staff said that they might be able to get us a shuttle to Walmart, then told us they couldn't fit us into the schedule after waiting a half hour. average hotel, nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “Standard 3 star hotel with broken facilites”
Reviews.Author: E-TravellerCanada
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights and the room is basically a clean double bed room. Pillows supplied were label hard and soft but there don't seem to be any difference between them ... all pillows are smaller but a bit on the hard side. One thing common in past complaints is the TV and toilet. The TV is a 40 inch Phillip LCD but there were only a handful of channels available and the reception is poor. Now the toilet get stuck on the first night and was not fixed till a couple days later. Unlike my stay in past Holiday Inn, this one seem to have room faciltities needing repair to make them workable. Staff wise the chambermaid and the front desk seem pretty friendly and always willing to help.

Reviews.Title: “A place to spend the night near the airport”
Reviews.Author: djess55555
Reviews.Content: This Holiday Inn doesn't have a lot going for it, although it is clean and the beds are comfortable and it is inexpensive and it is relatively near the airport (if you follow directions from the hotel staff instead of trusting Google maps). It's a decent value. Apparently occupied mostly by workers with jobs in the area. The bar restaurant is a loser. The breakfast is a disappointment. Adjacent to a sports bar that gets mobbed by singles every night of the week. Right next door is a somewhat more upscale suite hotel owned by the same people.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Staff Throughout!”
Reviews.Author: foodfan
Reviews.Content: Travelling from UK, arriving late evening having lost a bag, we were met with a gentleman on front desk who could not have been more helpful. My husband & I had booked 3 rooms through Priceline and thought the worst, but oh no, our booking was there and 3 rooms were located close together without hassle. The room was very clean, including bathroom, we were phoning around looking for our lost luggage and requested extra coffees, they arrived promptly within 10 minutes of the request. The breakfast buffet was refreshed on a regular basis and again the staff were superb, the coffee fabulous and hot! All of our party, from age 82 through to 29 were extremely happy and would happily stay again. Case located next day!

Reviews.Title: “Why?”
Reviews.Author: travelgirluk2010
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many times before the recent upgrade to the HI group and again, disappointed. The regular hotel I stay at was booked as was every other hotel in the area and this was my only option. I thought by now this hotel would have gotten the full upgrade, but no. The carpets in the rooms are worn and dirty, the beds are old and uncomfortable. No upgrade to flat screen TV's and every channel was fuzzy. The bathroom plumbing in the shower is backwards, meaning the hot comes on first so it took me a good two or three minutes to figure out what was going on, then realized I had the same confusion on another visit there. What annoyed me the most was the check in process. The guy at the front desk was wearing reindeer antlers (ok that was cute) but he was totally unattentive. When I arrive at the check in he was sorting the coupons for the priority members, told me to hold on a second, which turned in to about 3 minutes, then when he decided to check me in he discovers a problem with the phones, call someone on a walkie talkie, meanwhile another person walks up to the desk and he gives her his full attention, then turns around and starts to go back in to the office. At which point I threw my hands in the air and he then decided to check me in. What really fried me was I am a HI Honors member and the check in process should have taken less than two minutes. I stood there for 10 min waiting to get checked in. And don't get me started on the restaurant. High priced frozen food. Once in the room, the AC unit sounded like a machine used to pound rocks. It was so loud you couldn't hear the TV. Basically they upgraded the facade, added a new logo behind the desk, painted, replaced the carpets in the public areas, but that was it. This place never fails to disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “Not Good!”
Reviews.Author: steve1708
Reviews.Content: I do not like giving a really negative review but this is one, I filled out a questionaire with the points on that I am going to mention and noted that I would be happy to be contacted but this has not happened. This is probably why their customer service in general is pretty grim I am a very regular customer of the IHG group so know what to expect, this one was at best drab but more importantly the customer service was poor. Room Door did not lock at all on arrival, dealt with promptly when I reported it, but surely such a baisic thing should be checked before guest arrival? No Lunch service Breakfast waitress rude Reception staff "less than helpful( one person) Airport Shuttle runs late no explanation Trays and rubbish in Hallways overnight I will always forgive a lot if the service is good, but its not here so doe not have much to recomend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place To Stay If Passing Through”
Reviews.Author: Stargazerm31
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Holiday Inn â€“ Doral for one night was we were passing through on our flight from Panama to Europe. We obtained this hotel via Priceline which advertises it as an airport hotel which it isnâ€™t. If you want something close to the airport choose something else. Upon arrival we called the hotel and ask them to send the shuttle. They stated that it was on the way. Forty-five minutes later, we called back asking where it was and were told that it should be there soon that the first time we called the shuttle was on the way back from the airport to the hotel thus that was why it was so long. Note that the shuttle leaves to go to the airport at the top of the hour. It is a 20 to 25 minute trip from the hotel to the airport. Thus if you just miss the shuttle, it will be about 45 minutes till you see it again. Most of my issues were with the shuttle. The other issue we had is that if they are not needed for an airport run, the shuttle (at no charge) will take you and/or pick you up from the Dolphin Mall which is about 15 minutes away. They were a group of us that afternoon wanting to go and they took us with their shuttle. We were at the mall a few hours and called to see if they could pick up and take us back to the hotel. We were told that the shuttle was on the way back from the airport and would then come get us at entrance 5. We estimated 35 minutes. Well 45 minutes latter we called and were told that once arriving back they had to take people to the airport and it would be about 45 to 60 minutes. Now donâ€™t get me wrong, it is more important for them to take people to the airport than get us at the mall. The issue is we thought they were coming for us, wasted 45 minutes and ended up getting a cab. In short, take the shuttle if available to the mall but plan a cab back to the hotel (about $20). Upon arrival our room was not ready so they stored our luggage. We walked down to 37th St to an Italian Restaurant that was okay and pricy. Upon our return our room was ready. Our room was 207 and it was a king sized bed. The room was standard Holiday Inn. It was very well maintained, very clean and comfortable. The bathroom was clean and the shower worked very well with great water pressure. The bed was very comfortable (this is always subjective) for us. The WiFi was free and worked very well. We were going to go the Bar/Restaurant next door but it was packed at 8pm on a Friday night so ended up in the bar at the hotel. Very limited choices on the menu at the bar. We just had an appetizer item which was okay. Donâ€™t plan on this for your main meal. If you leave the hotel and turn left on 87th and go about 4 blocks there is a couple of long, barn like strip malls that have restaurants. One that we ate at that was excellent was Brisas de Espana. Good selection along there. The are is very business focused so not a lot to do right there within reasonable walking distance. If you have a car this wonâ€™t be an issue. If you are without transportation and cannot walk more than mile each way then you will be restricted or at the mercy and cost of Taxiâ€™s. They have a little mini-mart with sodas and a few pantry items. The staff was friendly and helpful. Checkout was fast and the return trip via shuttle to the airport the next day was easy and on time.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Customer Service in Dining”
Reviews.Author: charlesdwang
Reviews.Content: My in-room breakfast order wasn't picked up from door knob, and some other guest's in-room dinning tray was left in the hallway for the whole night and filled the hallway with the smell of leftover food. Next morning I went down for breakfast. Then they messed up my breakfast order for THREE times - wrong price, bacon instead of sausage even if he asked me about it, and forgot to serve me white toast.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to complain about.”
Reviews.Author: Ranzo1
Reviews.Content: Clean. Good staff. Convenient to Miami. Moderate Price, Empty Bar. Empty Restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: anchadwell
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel before taking a cruise in September 2010. Upon arriving at the hotel, check in was smooth. We were given our room keys and our room was beautiful! We had a king sized bed with a separate sitting area and kitchenette. For the two of us, the room was more than spacious. We had a nice view from our room and the grounds appeared to be well maintained. We needed to find a shop to pick up a few items before our cruise and the front desk staff was amazing. They directed us to the closest store and even offered to give us enough samples to take along with us on the cruise if we wanted to do that instead. We also asked for some assistance in picking out a restaurant and activities for the evening, and again we were very pleased with their assistance. Check out ran smoothly as well, and there were no hidden fees that appeared on our credit card statement. Overall we were very pleased with our experience at this location and would return for future stays.

Reviews.Title: “been before will come back again”
Reviews.Author: TrellisTrinidad
Reviews.Content: make sure you call to let courtesy bus know you are there we waited almost 2 hours Both drivers from other H/Inns told us to just be patient and wait!.Lovely staff and nice clean rooms 6th floor smoking so a bit strong on the smoke smell front. I was told the "booking company" asked for that floor but I know that is not so.They moved us no problem. Happy drivers very nice domestic staff. All in all very good.Our room was right by the ice machine but someone has to be in it. Pity it is not further away from rooms disturbing but comfy bed made up for it

Reviews.Title: “Exactely what you should expect from a Holiday inn”
Reviews.Author: jamilecttf
Reviews.Content: When you stay in a holiday in you now what you are lookinf for. and this one is not diference. There is a good variety of restaurants near by. The bar in front and the airport can distub a little because of the noise, but only if you are a real light sleeper.

Reviews.Title: “If you like to sleep in a hammock instead of on a mattress this place if for you.”
Reviews.Author: Gecko33139
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location for my business, but needs a total remodel. The photos are very deceiving as they were the reason I selected this hotel for a business trip. The room was clean, but smelled like mildew and when the AC compressor kicks on throughout the night it would make a rattling noise and woke me up each time. The worse of it all was the mattress (concave) and must have been 15 yrs old: after three days my back is still aching. I do not recommend this hotel to anyone. This was the worse sleep experience I have ever had and the front desk staff thanked me for letting them know the next day and agreed they need a remodel.

Reviews.Title: “NOT an airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: BitterrootTraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was advertised as an airport hotel, but it is not. The shuttle only runs once an hour and it took a good 15-20 minutes to reach the hotel. If you miss it, you have to wait another hour. And since the shuttle only runs once an hour, you arrive a lot earlier at the airport than you need to. It is a basic Holiday Inn, but not within walking distance of any restaurants other than the ones associated with the hotel and another hotel on the same grounds. The "restaurant" is more a sports bar than a place to get a meal...offerings were very simple and not very appealing. VERY slow service.

Reviews.Title: “Surpassed all expectations!”
Reviews.Author: AjayNayyar
Reviews.Content: Me and some friends stayed at this hotel for a week after getting a very competitive rate. At first, we were a little skeptical due to some of the bad reviews, but I can easily say that they surpassed all our expectations. The front desk staff were very polite, and always did everything they could to help. This was very appreciated by all of us. The pool is actually quite nice (albeit a bit cold), and we enjoyed lounging around in the pleasant Floridian evenings. The rooms were kept clean and housekeeping was great. There is also a free airport shuttle, and the front desk helped us send one out to pick up our friend who's flight was delayed. One thing I would like to say is that if you plan to get around a lot, it would be prudent to get a car. There are quite a few rental agencies around, and since we had one, we had no problems whatsoever. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just a good business type hotel Holiday Inn style”
Reviews.Author: hondotank
Reviews.Content: Perfectly adequate Holiday Inn beginning to show its age. Just 5 mins or so to Miami Airport but not close to any other major Miami attractions. Allowed to check in after midnight. No free breakfast here. Small pool that is shared with another hotel. Parking is free as is USA TODAY newspaper. Rooms are fine but nothing special - just your generic 1990's business style hotel. Got this as a Priceline choice. Hotel is across the street from a small park with a small lake and circular jogging trail. Hotel right behind the AleHouse (didn't eat there as it was too crowded. ) Lots of generic chain restaurants on the same street. Celebrity Cruise Line HQ is next door. 5 min from airport, 30 min plus to beaches. This was simply as place to stay after our cruise that was close to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Did The Job”
Reviews.Author: Luv_Montreal
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for one night with my cousin. We we had a 13 hr lay over( flight leaving at 10:35 am). The hotel does the job, there's a good sports bar/restaurant right near the hotel( like literally in the same parking lot). They served good food for a good price. The hotel is pretty close to the airport and has a free shuttle to and from. This hotel is not a beach hotel, and is not near the beach, so don't get your hopes up. The staff was cool,(front desk, & shuttle driver) The rooms are like every other holiday inn hotels, nothing special, but does the trick.

Reviews.Title: “Not Welcoming and Dingy”
Reviews.Author: NYgurl315
Reviews.Content: Front desk not welcoming at all upon check in, I had to ask all the questions including, is there breakfast, how I was paying for the room, late checkout, transportation...etc... Toilet got clogged, was locked out of room, paid $2.00!!! Yes $2.00 for a miniature size bag of cheetos!! No vending machine?!? Stayed 2 nights and received NO housekeeping service which meant NO new towels NO new sheets... was way too far for our adventures and will not be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Only one night”
Reviews.Author: atomsk404
Reviews.Content: But they still treated us awesome. Even drove us around in the rain to get ponchos so we had some cover while @ Ultra! only downside is the distance to the downtown area

Reviews.Title: “Stolen Items”
Reviews.Author: WITWIN
Reviews.Content: Need I say more? Cleaning crew that steals things - not good for the hotel - but they did reimburse me. Oh, and they don't respect the DO NOT DISTURB sign.... again, not good for the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: udayverma
Reviews.Content: We booked through hotwire for 1 night and 2 room.We got 1 smoking where we wanted non smoking room .But that is fine because we arrived late but what surprised me the most was how they treat a costumer who gets cheap rates with hotwire.I was told the rate is 3 times of what I paid with hotwire and if I wanted preference I should directly book with them and not through hotwire.Not a good customer rep.Computer kept for business purpose is joke and is antique,sluggish and log you out time to time. I am sure I won't be back to this hotel but if someone is looking for reasonable place this is fine . Best part is close to airport and just 5 minutes away.

Reviews.Title: “really nothing special”
Reviews.Author: minkanicky
Reviews.Content: Not too good situated, very loud from outside and inside, everything was quite o.k., but just nothing special. Not worth to come here a second time!!

Reviews.Title: “Solid value - Recommend having a car”
Reviews.Author: Aloha-Traveller
Reviews.Content: The front desk clerks were very friendly and nice. Our room was not large or fancy but big enough and quite adequate for us, a toddler, and they brought a pack-n-play for the baby. I recommend having a car since it isn't close to very much. That also made it relaxing and quiet. If you are a tourist in Miami, you'll have a car anyway, and it was easy to get around Miami and this is close to the Everglades. The breakfast was good, but earlier is you can since there is a rush of folks 15-30 minutes before breakfast ends.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased!”
Reviews.Author: BritColumbia
Reviews.Content: As we had a layover in Miami both at the beginning of our trip and at the end, we were only looking for a place to sleep. The place we stayed at first was a dump so we needed to try someplace else. This place was $20 more (on-line special price) and extremely worthwhile. The shuttle was fast, 15 min at 1:00 am, the hotel was very pleasant looking, clean, modern, and friendly. Staff spoke both English and Spanish and were very accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel....bad service.”
Reviews.Author: ricktb
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice in appearance. The rooms were well kept as were the hallways and the pool. The major downfall from this hotel was the front desk staff. They answered the phone in Spanish no matter what room was calling, and they made promises they didn't keep. We needed to go to a convenience store to buy some last minute items for our cruise and the staff told us they would call when the shuttle was available (which was said to be 40 minutes.) Two hours later we still hadn't received a call and the front desk staff didn't even apologize when they were called. BEWARE that the shuttle that they say you can get from the cruise port back to the hotel for "9.00 a person" is only available if you have a party of 6 OR MORE so if you're just a couple....be prepared to fork over 40 dollars for a taxi from the cruise port back to the hotel. Overall, if the staff was more honesty and helpful this would be a great hotel! As it is now I would not want to stay there ever again.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel in Miami? What a relief!”
Reviews.Author: KatsTMill
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travel to Miami every year. For the past couple of years we have seen increasingly deplorable rooms on Miami Beach while prices continued to do up. The last straw was last year, when we had an $85 per night "deal" on a room that was unclean, unsafe, and a fire hazard. This year we tried to stay by the airport for the first time and got the Holiday Inn Miami Airport West for $60/night through Priceline. We were a little skeptical about the location, as it wasn't close to many of our destinations and we are familiar with the fickle nature of Miami traffic. We were pleasantly surprised, however. Since the hotel is is Galloway Rd. it is on a major north-south artery in the city. Unlike I-95 and the Palmetto expressway, traffic actually moves on this road for most of the day. We had easy access to Coral Gables and all points south. By taking NW 36 St we had easy access to the airport expressway and the beaches without taking the infamous Dolphin expressway. We were actually able to get places we wanted to get to faster, even though we were further away from some of them. As for the hotel itself, it is a very nice Holiday Inn. The rooms were clean and secure (a plus after last year's debacle). We had plenty of space on a king sized bed. It was quiet (though I don't think many guests were staying when we were there). The staff was very friendly. The only problem we had was minor in that the shower had trouble maintaining a constant temperature. Sometimes it would have trouble getting warm enough, while other times you couldn't get it cool enough. That is hardly a major problem though. The high speed internet was sometimes tricky, but the place had free parking. Free parking is a cherished luxury in Miami for a hotel, so I will take it since, in my opinion, charging for parking is one of the most cheapskate things mankind has invented.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price”
Reviews.Author: cchri1p
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel for $45 on Priceline, which is a fair price for what you get. I got a room in Tower II, which seemed to have been recently renovated, and it was fairly nice (with a dismal view of a canal!). There is free (but very slow) wireless internet, and free parking as well. If you are using this hotel as a place to spend the night before/after a flight then I think it is a decent choice, but it would not be my idea of a great place to spend a holiday.

Reviews.Title: “What a crappy hotel”
Reviews.Author: ehardwick
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night before leaving Miami on a cruise. When we arrived at the hotel the lobby looked really nice, that was the only part of the hotel we can say that about. Our room was incredibly musty smelling. There were dehumidifiers in the hallways so there was evidently some water damage to the hotel causing the odor. I happened to have a bottle of Febreeze with me and I ended up using half of it on this hotel room just to make it smell bearable. The staff were not very helpful, in fact one front desk attendant was very rude. I asked him for directions to a nearby marina and he laughed at me and basically told me I was crazy, that no marina by that name existed. I then used the internet in the lobby to look up the address for the marina and showed the front desk attendant that it did in fact exist. To top it all off, the next morning as I was brushing my teeth I looked down to the bathroom counter top to see roaches on it. Thank God we were already checking out that day!

Reviews.Title: “One night stay on way to Cruise - there might be better options”
Reviews.Author: Laura T
Reviews.Content: There might be better options to stay at for one night before your cruise. My friend and I came after 1:00 am so we had to arrange our own transportation to the hotel. That cost about $25.00 from the airport. I was somewhat dissappointed in our room. Our beds seemed way inferior from a Holiday Inn Express that I had stayed at in Arizona. Plus there was two old soap bars in the shower soap holder and it looked like the garbage cans had not been emptied near the beds. Makes you think what else had not been cleaned. Don't eat in the restaurant. We both had the same vegetable omelet in the restaurant area. The middle tasted cold which makes me think they were made ahead of time and just put in the microwave before serving. That is the only thing we both had the same to eat in the last 24 hours and we both got stomach aches very soon afterwards making several trips to the bathroom. I let the manager know. They said they would call back and never did. However I do want to say that the staff behind the front desk were very nice and helpful during our stay. They arranged transportation to the port which cost $20. a person. We got our room thru price line with a bid of $60.00 plus tax. It does have a computer you can use to get on the Internet which was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accomodations for the money”
Reviews.Author: kateyann
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before going on a Cruise. It was located a ways away from the Port, but shuttle service was offered for $9.00 per person. Also they have a free shuttle from the airport. They also offered shuttle service within 5 mile radius as long as the shuttle wasn't in use already. They took us to the Dolphin Mall and we just called when we were ready to leave and they came to get us. A good restaurant was close by. Breakfast was included and had lots to choose from. They also had cans of pop and chips, etc.for sale at a reasonable price. Free internet access. Service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Did not work for precruise”
Reviews.Author: polodad
Reviews.Content: We use Priceline for booking precruise hotels. I got too aggressive with pricing on this one and got the Holiday Inn Miami Airport West (Doral) for $75. The main complaint is the hotel is 15 minutes drive from the airport and in a direction opposite from the Port of Miami. the free shuttle bus took 1 hour and several call to pick us up at the airport or the alternative was a $24 cab ride. At the hotel the only 2 restaurants nearby had 45 minute waits. In the morning the choice was the free shuttle back to tjhe airport & then a $24 cab to the port or bit the bullet & pay $45 for a cab direct to the port from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fine property, though on the edge of being an "airport" one”
Reviews.Author: silentbob007
Reviews.Content: I was perhaps a little too loose with my Priceline bidding (instead of waiting for a better deal in a better area) and got the 3-star Holiday Inn - Miami Airport West (Doral) for a bid of $55. This hotel was, in my opinion, at the very boundary of what could be considered an "airport" hotel, and their airport shuttle only ran once an hour. We were quite delayed, so once we had collected our bags, we called about the shuttle but, being tired, decided to take a cab instead of waiting the 30 minutes for the shuttle's scheduled arrival. The cab ride ended up being about $23 ... like I said, this hotel is just barely an "airport" hotel. Once at the hotel, the desk clerk was very nice (though asked for no forms of ID) and gave us a non-smoking room with two beds even though we were of course originally booked in a "Priceline" room that was a king-smoking room. The room was nothing special, but it seemed clean and did offer free, if slow, wi-fi. Being late, we walked next door to the Doral Ale House for dinner which was fairly tasty, had good drink specials, and was packed for the Indy-Jacksonville NFL game. The next morning we strolled around the neighborhood to find perhaps a cheaper breakfast than what was offered by the Holiday Inn. The neighborhood seemed very walkable and well-kept (unlike some of the war-zone areas I've seen in Miami). We turned right and found absolutely nothing (besides Carnival's headquarters). We then headed back the other way and found a Dunkin' Donuts in a strip mall. After a quick breakfast, it was back to the room to get ready to leave for the ship. We debated on whether or not to take the free shuttle back to the airport to catch a fixed-rate cab to the port or to just have the hotel call us a cab. We went with the latter, and after a 15-minute wait, our cab arrived. A 20-minute and $40 cab ride later, we arrived at the Port of Miami. This hotel seemed like a fine place to stay, though my final thought is that it is not necessarily convenient as a pre-cruise location.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic deal”
Reviews.Author: schetman
Reviews.Content: The value of this hotel was excellent. Bid on priceline and got a room for $50, so wasn't expecting much, but was pleasantly surprised. The beds were comfy, the check-in staff was amazing, and so was the service at the cafe in the morning. There are lots of restaurants nearby, so that's convenient. Can't complain about anything, except, don't order the waffles, they are more like eggos, but husbands breakfast was amazing (breakfast burrito)

Reviews.Title: “CGreat Pre-Cruise Stay”
Reviews.Author: libertycruiser40
Reviews.Content: After reading several of the reviews, I was expecting a dump. To my surprise, the hotel was better than I anticipated. Its not the Ritz, but for a $50 Priceline bid, I cant complain. I arrived at the hotel at 10am, rooms werent ready, so I went to grocery store down the street to get to soft drinks, then had lunch at Tony Roma's. When I returned the very friendly staff checked me into room 418. I did eat in the restaurant before I checked out. It was both tasty and efficient. The entire stay was on par with what one would expect from a Holiday Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional customer service”
Reviews.Author: Slucie
Reviews.Content: We cannot fault the service at this Hotel. After returning our rented RV we arrived at our hotel much earlier than we had anticipated. (10am). The receptionist was extremley polite and helpful and informed us that it wasn't a problem, but as the hotel was fully booked we would need to wait for our rooms to be cleaned. We waited in a very pleasant lounge, with lashings of very good free coffee. An hour later when our rooms were still not ready, the General Manager came to check that we were ok and apologised for keeping us waiting. He asked if we were happy to go to a sister hotel next door, which was the Staybridge, as there were rooms available for us. We gladly accepted, and were delighted to be given suites at no additional cost. On checking in we were informed that not only was breakfast included, but we were also invited to a free guest BBQ that evening. We had a great stay, the staff were polite and helpful. We cannot fault either the Holiday Inn or the Staybridge, as they are both freindly and clean hotels, and it was made even better by the fact that we booked it online with Priceline and only paid Â£35, what a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Good for one night”
Reviews.Author: croaziera
Reviews.Content: Spent one night, October 3, before our cruise out of Port of Miami. Rented a car and drove from Miami Airport. Arrived at hotel at 2330 hours. The hotel was a little farther from the airport than I expected but it was still only 10-15 minutes. The hotel is in a nice area, surrounded by other hotels and restaurants. There is a Walmart about 2 miles going left from the hotel on the main road. Check in was smooth. The hotel seemed to have been remodeled recently inside and out. The room was adequate and clean. Only complaint was the loud window air conditioning. I finally had to turn it off to get some sleep. Did not use the pool or restaurant on site. Overall, it was a good stay for $65 one night, including taxes.

Reviews.Title: “OK, if you get a good price.”
Reviews.Author: mortenab
Reviews.Content: This hotel is about 10min from the airport with free shuttle bus. We had a wait a bit to long on the bus going from airport to hotel (about 40min before it came), but on the way back it was scheduled times. For just one night we didnt had the chance to explore the area and so, but the room was fine. Clean and ok size, but the air condition was as earlier written a bit loud...If you get a good rate its worth it, otherwise, they have other hotels in the area, like Days inn, etc which offers free shuttle also..

Reviews.Title: “OK, but not a 3 Star”
Reviews.Author: DKandGW
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ok, but is definitely not a 3 star. More like a 2 or 2.5. Hotel appearance is just OK, rooms OK, but the air conditioner noise alone costs it a full star. We could barely hear each other over the noise. When I tried to look up something in the yellow pages it was in Spanish! Front desk loaned me their English yellow pages. Overall, the stay was pleasant with the exception of the air conditioner, but overpriced unless you book with Priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Good stopover hotel”
Reviews.Author: madge62
Reviews.Content: Stayed here April 25, 2008 for 1 night, pre-cruise. Quite a nice looking hotel inside and out. The staff were very nice to us. Our room was average, clean and quiet. We checked in fairly early and decided to go to the Dolphin Mall. Their airport shuttle dropped us off at the mall and returned for us several hours later, great service and saved us a whopping taxi cost. Had a good dinner at Tony Roma's which was down the road a bit, just had difficulty crossing said road, didn't seem to be any crosswalks at the lights! Would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible - Bad Rooms, Terrible Guest service - 1.5 star”
Reviews.Author: ak_Denver
Reviews.Content: True unjustice to the star rating. Whoever rated as three star deluxe this hotel must be out of their mind. Musty smell in the hall way, old rooms, noisy AC with manual controls, dirty and the list goes on. Added to that guest service is horrible.

Reviews.Title: “disorganized”
Reviews.Author: moven
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for one night. We arrived well after check in time and were told that we would have to wait for our room to be ready. This took well over 30 minutes. While waiting I tried to buy a soda but couldn't since they could not change a $10 bill. They tried to put it on my room bill but couldn't because the hadn't given me a room yet. There were probably 5 people be hind the desk. They all seemed to get in each others way. Once we finally got checked in, I went to the busines center to use the computer to check in for my flight the next day. There was nothing in the business center. At the desk, I was told that the computer had been stolen and that I would have to go to the hotel next door. Everything was acceptable until the next morning when we went to breakfast. The resturant does not open until 7:30 so we were in a bit of a hurry so we could catch the 8:00 shuttle. The lady who runs the resturant arrived after 7:30 but wouldn't seat us because according to her watch it was not yet 7:30. She was extremely rude. It took a while for her to serve coffee, then she disappeared. By the time we were finally able to order and were served our breakfast we did not have time to eat since the shuttle was ready to leave.

Reviews.Title: “It was a disaster from the get go.”
Reviews.Author: IowaCritic
Reviews.Content: It was a disaster from the get go. Arrived at Miami airport, retrieved our luggage, tried to call hotel, got busy signal for at least 1-1/2 hours to get the shuttle. Were told shuttle would come by on the hour and never saw one. Another nice shuttle driver from another hotel nearby said he would take us to the Holiday Inn. Got to the hotel, went in to check in, explained our situation that we tried calling, they said a storm knocked out their phone lines and also said their shuttle came by every hour on the hour but we were there 1-1/2 hours and saw no shuttle. Checked in, hotel OK.

Reviews.Title: “Setting New Standards”
Reviews.Author: underpressure
Reviews.Content: Rarely do business travelers have the privilege of staying at a standard bearer hotel. Surely this is the standard of what a Holiday Inn should not look like. filthy nasty carpets, non-existent advertised lounge, dirty rooms, drunks peeing on the outside of the building. This place has it all. (Including the hookers in the elevators.)

Reviews.Title: “Good 1 or 2 Day Hotel”
Reviews.Author: alngeoffro
Reviews.Content: Price was certainly right. Hotel and room were clean and acceptable. Close to airport and there's a Steak/Ale Restaurant right in front for dining. Need a car to see any Miami attractions. Also a nice park across the street for excercise. None of the equipment in the Fitness Center was working when we were there so the park came in handy.

Reviews.Title: “so so...”
Reviews.Author: rookie75
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night. Good location a couple of minutes from the airport. Free shuttlebus availiable. My room was ok no so complains there but the property is very run down and would really need a facelift.

Reviews.Title: “Decent but not great”
Reviews.Author: fjnovak1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night prior to flying to Treasure Cay on a family vacation. Me and my sister's room smelled terrible (like mold) but our parents room was ok. The computer in the business center only worked intermittently, but everything else was fine. Not the worst Holiday Inn I've ever been at, but not the best either.

Reviews.Title: “A very reasonable airport hotel”
Reviews.Author: dunnitt
Reviews.Content: We spent one night here after a flight from the UK- the second time we have done so. The check in staff were very pleasant and efficient, the rooms were more than adequate and the bar and bar snacks were good as was the buffet breakfast. The bar has a good view of the airport and we were not at all troubled by aircraft noise. In the morning the shuttle driver kindly dropped us off at the Hertz car rental location on his way to the airport. This is a perfectly adequate hotel for an overnight stay after a flight. It is easy to get to from the airport ( taxi or shuttle), and the cost of a stay is very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated and overrated”
Reviews.Author: carib_n_travel
Reviews.Content: I got a good rate for an overnight stay while connecting to an overseas flight but was not impressed by the quality of the rooms. The front desk person was very helpful when I arrived but then I was put into a smoking room which had a horrible smell and dirty carpets although I had requested a non smoking room. I then complained and the guy at the front desk seemed surprised that I had been given that room and switched me to a non smoking on the second floor. Overall the room is a bit small although the bed is comfy and the bathrooms are much bigger than I expected and clean. The property feels a bit run down and is more of a two star than a three. OK if you are staying one night as I did, otherwise book a nicer hotel closer to the airport. Oh and forget getting the free shuttle from the airport - a cab will cost $25 and you won't have to wait for ages - you can always get the shuttle in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Fine, nothing more”
Reviews.Author: trientalis
Reviews.Content: We arrived really tired from a very delayed flight, and the room was fine. For the price, I would prefer washable duvet covers instead of the yucky bedspreads. Anyways, we liked the free wireless internet, and the hotel suited us just fine-- we slept well and had no troubles. They were happy to hold our reservation until 3am because of the delayed flight, and to keep a non-smoking king for us, which we appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “fine experience for stop-over before flight”
Reviews.Author: StChris
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel some months in advance so got a decent price. They had tasty free cookies at the check-in counter. The room was spacious with 2 queen beds and the bathroom was also roomy. Good-sized tv. There was no mini-bar. There was an in-room safe which we didn't use. We did not have time to use the pool and did not eat at the hotel. There is a bar-restaurant next to the hotel but we walked across the street to eat at the Tony Roma's. It was a Friday so go before 8 pm to avoid waiting in line. We used the free internet available at the hotel's business centre, a nice feature. They have an airport shuttle service starting at 6 am but we had to leave earlier than that so took a taxi. In summary, we were quite satisfied with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Area, Near Airport”
Reviews.Author: Heinz22
Reviews.Content: Stayed for business there for 2 days. It is easily accessible from the Airport. Breakfast for 10,85 USD was OK but not more than average. You hear the airplanes from the outside but for me it was OK to sleep. Rooms are large enough and clean. Staff friendly. Parking is free of charge.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't Suggest Staying Here!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on business, the staff was so/so...the restaurant was not good, I WOULDN'T recommend it, the food was over-priced and not good...and the staff was RUDE. The last day we were there we sat at a table and nobody helped us not even once! The complimentary shuttle took an hour to pick us up from the airport. Overall, the hotel itself was not bad, just the staff at the restaurant. There isn't a lot to do in the area and to go to dolphin mall, etc in a cab would cost at least $20.00 one way!!! People treated us like we were from another planet....so I wouldn't go back! If you're going to stay here don't eat at the restaurant!

Reviews.Title: “Very helpful staff ”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Found the hotel staff very helpful. No noise from the aircraft. Very nice bar and restaurant. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: Degumaster
Reviews.Content: I have used the Holiday-Inn Miami-Airport West few times and every stay was perfect. Clean and new rooms, quiet, nice staff and near to the airport. Some people here write about a disco / restaurant and loud music from the 9th floor, the Holiday-Inn Miami Airport West do not have a disco and 9 floors, only 6 floors and a restaurant on the ground floor!! All the people with this bad disco and loud music experience have not stayed at the HI-Miami Airport WEST Hotel, this peoples have stayed at the HI-Miami-INTERNATIONAL Airport Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: The_curious_limper
Reviews.Content: Really nice well appointed Holiday Inn. Clean and comfortable rooms and a great rate. Does have a bit of aircraft noise but what does one expect from an airport hotel. Food in the restaurant is really very good.

Reviews.Title: “Had no problems”
Reviews.Author: patmed
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night, just before Hurricane Frances struck, so shutters on downstairs windows. Had no problems. Staff friendly. Rooms clean and well kept. but a little on the small side for an American hotel - if you are used to UK ones then quite big. Stayed on the 4th floor at the back, heard no noise? Would recommend for a short period. Not much in that area for a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “OK ... for a few hours”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed there since we got to Miami late and did not want to drive my family around in this area at night. Room was decent and breakfast ok. Since it was a nice and warm morning and we had a couple of hours to kill, we went to the pool to find out it was not clean at all and not heated. Overall, at just $90 including airport shuttle, night and breakfast, it is hard to complaint.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Awful! Don't bother! We stayed here because we were arriving late into Miami and didn't want the hassle of having to navigate a strange city in the dark. The room was ok - but nothing special. The worst thing however was the noise, apart from being woken at about 1am by loud music which was coming from the disco on the top floor and went on til 3am, there was also the noise from the planes going over, which thankfully drowned out the dreadful music.After a disturbed nights sleep, breakfast was on the cards - after failing to get any response from room service for half an hour, we went to the restaurant, where we had to wait an hour for our food. Normally we'd have walked out, but not knowing where else to go and being starving having not eaten the night before kept us in our seats, there were many who did walk out though!

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wow! The people at this hotel where great! I stay at many Holiday Inns. sometimes you get a good one sometimes you get a bad one. I stayed here in February and found this to be one of the best place I've ever stayed. The room was clean and the clerk who helped me was phenominal. My car rental company gave my reservation away and the clerk at the hotel took the time to get me a rental at another agency AND get me shuttled there. I will definately be back here on my next trip to miami.

Reviews.Title: “terrible Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Holiday Inn Miami Airport West- Our experience at this Holiday Inn was one of our worst in 20 years of travel. This time I was traveling with my wife and two children flying from Boston to Miami (a 9 hour affair from house to hotel). When I booked the room I phoned the hotel to inquire about their airport shuttle service since we were arriving late in the evening. I was informed that the service was available until midnight. Since we were due to land at 11:30 I did not see a problem. (We originally had reservations at the Intercontinental Miami Airport but their shuttle ended at 10PM). Upon arriving at the airport I phoned the Holiday Inn at the baggage area. They informed that the shuttle was not available since the driver did not show up for work. This was quite discouraging since I was standing there with my family and 7 bags ready to start our vacation (on New Years Eve no less). The gentlemen at the front desk informed me to take a cab and they should reimburse me. After waiting many minutes in a cab line the cab took us to the hotel and we paid $20 after your desk told us it was about $10 to $15. After we got out of the cab there was no bellman available to help us with our bags, so my small son and I took them inside ourselves. We checked in at the front desk and the clerk said he would call a bellman. After waiting for many minutes the front desk clerk disappeared and there was no bellman in site. We therefore lugged our bags ourselves to the 5th floor and opened the room. Upon entering the room we noticed a strange smell similar to bug spray repellant. We attempted to open the windows but they were sealed shut. So we opened the room door for a while and settled down. However after many minutes we noticed the smell not dissipating so I called the front desk to get another room. Upon entering the other room I noticed the same odor and called down to the front desk clerk. He informed that he had checked other rooms and noticed the same smell. After a long discussion with my wife we decidrcontinental Hotel. By now it was nearly 2AM. I had to telephone a cab and wait 30 minutes for it to arrive. The front desk clerk apologized and told me there would be no charge for the room at the Holiday Inn. I paid the cab driver $10 and the Intercontinental staff was extra good at handling our bags at 2:30 AM as well as getting a sandwich in my room for my hungry son. Subsequently a charge appeared on my credit card for the Holiday Inn room. So I phoned a Mr. Nelson Martinez hotel manager. He informed me that he would investigate the matter and return my call the next day. 3 days later I phoned and he advised me that he had not looked into it. I phoned again the next day and he said that yes there was a mistake and that he would be crediting my charge card account. Also he would pay me the $20 cab ride. Now since that last conversation I have phoned him long distance 4 times, left messages, and have never seen the credit or heard back from him. Unbelievable!

HotelInfo.Name: Holiday Inn Miami - Doral Area
HotelInfo.Address: 3255 NW 87th Ave, Miami, FL 33172
